text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Bengo | native_name = | native_name_lang = | settlement_type = Province | image_map = Bengo in Angola (2024).svg | mapsize = 200px | map_alt = | map_caption = Bengo, province of Angola | image_map1 = | mapsize1 = | map_alt1 = | map_caption1 = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Angola | seat_type = Capital | seat = Caxito | government_footnotes = | government_type = | leader_party = | leader_name = Mara Baptista Quiosa | leader_title = Governor | leader_name1 = António Martins | leader_title1 = Vice-Governor for the Political, Economic and Social Sector | leader_name2 = Domingos Guilherme | leader_title2 = Vice-Governor for Technical Services and Infrastructures | total_type = | unit_pref = | area_magnitude = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 31371 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 356641 | population_as_of = 2014 Census | population_density_km2 = auto | blank_name_sec1 = HDI (2018) | blank_info_sec1 = 0.565 · 6th | iso_code = AO-BGO | website = | footnotes = }} Bengo is a province of Angola. Its capital is Caxito. There are about 450,000 people. The province is bordered by the provinces of Zaire to the North, Uige to the Northeast, Cuanza Norte to the East, and Cuanza Sul to the South. The Kissama National Park and the Kibinda Forest Reserve are here. ==References== Category:Provinces of Angola
title: Bengo Province
